pageContext.claim: Our manufacturing numbers are fantastic…. We have almost 600,000 jobs.”
pageContext.analysis: Manufacturers have added about 480,000 jobs since Trump took office. Since his election in 2016, the job gain is about 525,000. Manufacturing jobs growth slumped badly in 2019, adding only 46,000 jobs during the year. U.S. manufacturing was in a mild recession for all of 2019, according to data released by the Federal Reserve.
